item.title: Quest Gamebook: Previous page links remain active?
item.description:
Noob question. I noticed this when using hyperlinks with the {page} command to navigate to different pages.

Say, the gamebook is three pages:
When playing on page1 I click a link to go to page2.
Page2 text pops up underneath and that link on page1 deactivates and becomes regular text. This, I assume is normal behavier.

But, if I click a link on page2 to go to say, page3, page3 text pops up underneath but the previous text above still contains the active links. Why are page2 links still active when I've moved on to page3?

Confusing to explain I know. Only happens when I use the {page} command in the text field for navigation.

item.title: When using hyperlinks, how do you make the command appear appear next to the > instead of on the following line? (Inform 7)
item.description:
I ran into this issue with three different extensions that support hyperlinks: Basic Hyperlinks by Emily Short, Inline Hyperlinks by Erik Temple, and Flexible Windows.

Is there a way to make the text appear next to the > instead of on the following line?

Sample transcript of current behavior:

>
take
What do you want to take?

item.title: How do you use a hyperlink to paste text without (in effect) pressing enter? (Flexible Windows, Inform 7)
item.description: I'd like to use hyperlinks to paste partial commands at the prompt, and allow the player to finish typing the command, but when I use the built-in hyperlink behavior of Flexible Windows, clicking the link automatically submits the text as a complete command. Is there a way to just paste the text and leave it be?
